Bintou, seated in the middle of the photo, grows maize. She intends to use her loan to buy farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to cultivate one hectare. The produce is sold right in the village and in the market, after the harvest, and she sells to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She expects to make a profit of 70,000 F CFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay the loan and also to help her extended family with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds and pay the fees for plowing.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel de 49 años de edad es una persona amable, responsable y trabajador, vive con su hijo en casa propia, el se dedica desde hace 13 años hacer todo tipo de viajes en su pick up, tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan por ser muy responsable a la hora de manejar, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, miguel esta solicitando un crédito para comprar repuestos para su vehículo y darle mantenimiento, ya que su vehículo es su única fuente de trabajo y así poderle dar a su hijo lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Miguel, 49 years old, is a friendly, responsible and hardworking person. He lives with his son in his own home. He has been working for 13 years making all kinds of trips in his pick-up truck. He has a large number of customers, as he is sought after for being very responsible with his driving.

With the earnings from his work Miguel has been able to pay for some of his household expenses. Since his vehicle is his only source of work, Miguel is asking for a loan to buy parts for his car and to do repair work on it. In this way, he will be able to give his son all that he needs without any restrictions.

loans.use: to buy parts for his car and do repair work on it.

loans.name: Blanca Eloisa

texts.es: Blanca de 44 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, refrescos, entre otros, tiene 4 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca is 44 and lives with her husband and two children in their own house. She owns a store where she sells basic household goods: beans, milk, eggs, bread, rice, sugar, candy, beverages, and more. She has run the business for four years, which has given her the experience to increase profits. The store is in her house, which is in a well-tracked area and is known to neighbors. She has many customers because her store is well stocked.

Blanca wants to grow her business and make another investment, but she lacks funding. She has applied for a loan to buy needed merchandise for her store. She is certain she can pay the loan and also give her family a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, eggs, bread, rice, sugar, candy, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Kotognogontala  I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles  au quartier  FANGATONON  de LOUTANA, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leurs troisièmes prêts avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz avec  ABY FOUSSENY  debout au milieu sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO  après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 80.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group called Kotognogontala I are married women with an average age of 45 and six children, on average, all living in traditional families in the Fangatonon area of Loutana, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the micro finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed with their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the instituion and their other two loans were correctly reimbursed.  

Aby Fousseny, standing in the middle of the photo, cultivates rice. She intends to buy farm inputs, seeds and pay plowing fees to cultivate half a hectare. Her produce is sold right in the village and in Sikasso, after the harvest, and she sells to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She expects to make a profit of 80,000 F CFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loam and also to help the extended family with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds and pay the fees for plowing, etc.

loans.name: Otto Olmedo

texts.es:
OTTO tiene 58 años de edad de estado civil casado tiene hijos, vive con la esposa y con el nieto de 14 años de edad en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

OTTO  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y fréjol. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, urea, abonos

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada semana. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá invertir en la agricultura y al vender los productos podrá cancelar la deuda.

Enfrenta desfíos cómo las pequeñas enfermedades de la familia. El sueño es trabajar un poco mas para tener dinero para cuando este enfermo. En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar paseos con la familia.
texts.en:
Otto is 58 years old. He is married and has children. He lives with his wife and his 14-year-old grandson in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the Bruniquilde communal bank located in the rural community of Calabi in Ventanas canton. The members work in farming.

Otto is a farmer and grows corn and beans. He is asking for the loan to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizer, urea, and manure.

He will purchase the products in the city of Ventanas every week. With the help of the loan, he will be able to invest in farming and, upon selling the produce, he will be able to pay back the debt.

He faces challenges such as his family's minor illnesses. His dream is to work a little more in order to have money for when he is sick. In his free time, he likes to take walks with the family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizer, urea, and manure

loans.name: Shazade

texts.en:
Shazade is very thankful to all of the Kiva lenders for her previous loan. With this support she has managed to improve her business by being able to purchase another sewing machine and additional materials for her work. Shazade mentioned that she has also improved the conditions for her family through her business by being able to provide adequate income for them. 

She is still very happy for having her successful business and she is planning to continue to work in the future. At the moment she is requesting a second loan for the same business so that she may add another sewing machine as she has a lot of customer demand since she has expanded her business. She hopes to increase, expand and generate even more income from her business and provide a more secure and stable life for her family. She really appreciates all of the Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine and materials for her work

loans.name: Elsie Maribel

texts.es:
ELSIE tiene 35 años de edad de estado civil unión lire tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y con el esposo en la ciudad de Ventans Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC AVANZA sus miembros se dedican a la Agricultura todos viven en el Sector del Recinto Agua Frías, prácticamente se han criado en esa zona, se dedican a Labores agrícolas u pecuarias en su mayoría. 

ELSIE se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz,arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insumos, urea, balanceado y pollos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá aumentar las siembras y aumnetar la cría de pollos.
   
Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Ventanas. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia y el mal clima.
El sueño es tener un riego propio para los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicarce a los hijos.
texts.en:
Elsie is 35 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and has two children. She lives with her partner and children in Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province. She is a member of the Avanza community bank, whose members are farmers living in the area near the Agua Frías precinct. Most of them grew up in the area and make their livings by farming and raising poultry.

Elsie grows corn and rice for a living, and she also raises pigs and chickens. She requests a loan to buy seeds, supplies, urea, animal feed, and chickens. With the help of the loan, she will be able to increase her crops and increase the number of pigs that she raises. She makes her purchases and sells her products in Ventanas.

The challenges that she faces include competition and bad weather. Her dream is to have her own irrigation system for her crops. In her free time, she likes to spend time with her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, urea, animal feed, and chickens.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is 43 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She lives with her husband who works as a farmer at Madaba-Jordan. Nawal has been working in trading children's clothes for 4 months. She started her project with her relatives and neighbors. Then she expanded her work zone. 

Nawal is seeking a loan to be able to expand her business by increasing the quantity of her merchandise and buying women's pajamas to trade, as she doesn’t have enough money for it now.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and women's pajamas for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed for her poultry business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 50 años es una mujer trabajadora y vive en compañía de sus 2 pequeños hijos en la casa de material rústico que adquirió hace algunos años. Desde niña aprendió a cuidar de sus sembríos, pues posee terrenos en donde cultiva café y cítricos, gracias a estos productos obtiene muy buenos ingresos, pero como el café en el mercado es inestable, también se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de frutas, para ello acondicionó un espacio en su casa donde todos los día recolecta cítricos maduros que lleva vende a los comerciantes mayoristas, aprovecha también en comercializar sus propias cosechas por lo que recibe un ingreso adicional. Ahora desea mejorar la cosecha de café, pues gracias a la variedad que sembró este año no tiene muchas perdida con la plaga. Este es su segundo préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Juana, invertirá S/.2800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Juana, 50, is a hard-working woman who lives with her 2 small children in a house she acquired several years ago made from rustic materials. Starting when she was a girl, she learned to take care of her crops, since she has land where she grows coffee and citrus fruits. She earns a very good income thanks to this produce, but since coffee is unstable in the market, she also buys and sells fruit. For this, she outfitted a space in her house where every day she collects mature citrus fruit that she sells to wholesale merchants. She also makes the most of selling her own harvests, from which she receives additional income. Now she wants to improve the coffee crop, since thanks to the variety she planted this year she did not have many losses with the insect infestation. This is her second loan with Kiva, and she feels thankful for the support that she receives to move ahead. She also promises to make her loan repayments in a punctual manner. Juana will use the 2000 soles to buy organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to nourish her crops

loans.name: Gulom

texts.ru:
Гулом с детства начал заниматься откормом скота. В молодости его родители сами ухаживали за скотом, со временем Гулом сам начал пасти скот и продолжил своё дело. Когда этот бизнес начал приносить ему доход он  всерьез занялся этим делом. Сейчас у него несколько  голов скота, но он хочет увеличить поголовье скота, и тем самым  развивать свой бизнес и увеличить капитал. 
У Гулома 4 прекрасных детей. Он мечтает чтобы его дети выросли здоровыми и получили хорошее образование, которое он по финансовым проблемам  не смог получить в юности. У него большие планы на будущее и делает все чтобы осуществить свои планы.     Гулом также учит своего старшего сына как правильно ухаживать за скатом и отдал ему  часть своего  скота .  Сыну тоже нравится ухаживать за скотом и он всячески помогает своему отцу. На данный момент у Гулом   планирует увеличить поголовье скота, так как сейчас выгодно покупать.
На полученный кредит Гулом хочет купить скот,и расширить свой бизнес.  Заранее благодарит Арванд за содействие и помощь.
texts.en:
Gulom learned about raising cattle from his parents when he was a child. Over time, he began to take care of them himself and operated his own business. When the business started to bring in income, he began to focus on it seriously. He now has a few head of cattle, but would like to increase their number to expand his business and earn more money.

Gulom has 4 wonderful children and he wants them to grow up health and well-educated. He himself could not go to school due to financial problems. He has big plans for the future and is doing everything he can to achieve his goals. Gulom is teaching his oldest son how to properly care for cattle and has given him some cattle of his own. His son likes to take care of the cattle and always helps his father. For the moment Gulom is planning to increase his herds because it is currently profitable to buy livestock. He wants to use the loan to buy cattle and expand his business. He thanks Arvand in advance for their help and support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a conservative woman so she asked her son Abdulrahman to take her place in the photo.
Faten lives in Wehdat-Jordan with her husband and her family which consists of four members. Faten has a son who is in his fourth year studying for a bachelor's degree in finance. But as Faten is having financial difficulties, she is seeking a loan to be able to pay for her son's study fees so that he will be able to work in his study field after his graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son's study fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her study fees

loans.name: Glenda De Los Angeles

texts.es: Glenda de 53 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 7 años, tiene mucha clientela porque vende su mercadería a buen precio, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su hija, doña Glenda esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar mas ropa por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su hija lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Glenda is 53 years old. She has been selling used clothing for 7 years. She has many customers because she sells her merchandise at a good price. Her business is located in her home. Her earnings cover the household expenses. She lives in her own home with her daughter. Glenda is asking for a loan in order to buy more clothing in bulk as this is her only source of working to obtain higher earnings and give her daughter what she needs without lacking for anything.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk for her business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is 24 years old and lives in Zarqaa’ with her family which consists of four members. She has a brother who is in his fourth year studying for a bachelor's degree in accounting. As Aishas’ family is facing financial difficulties, she is requesting a loan for her brother to cover his study fees to be able to work in his study field in the future.

loans.use: to cover the study fees of her brother

loans.name: Qaisra's Group

texts.en: Qaisra is 31 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver, by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it, as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Qaisra, as a member of this three-person group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will enable him to resume his business. Qaisra is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To cover the cost of repairs to the rickshaw that her husband drives.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 24 years old, and a single man from Deir el Balah. His father works as an employee in the public sector and gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Ahmad is still a student in the university. He requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Ahmad to buy a new laptop for his studies. He needs the laptop, because the electricity is not always available in his area. Electricity comes for only a few hours in the day. Having a laptop will help Ahmad at the times when there is no electricity, because it is rechargeable. This will help him to complete his work and achieve good marks. 

Ahmad appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Hanife

texts.en:
Hanife is very thankful to all of the Kiva lenders for her previous loan. With that loan, she managed to improve her business by being able to purchase needed materials for her work. Hanife reported that her business has improved and also emphasized that she has been able to improve the conditions for her family at the same time. She is very happy for having her successful business and she is planning to continue to work in the future.

At the moment she is requesting a second loan for the same business in order to buy a sewing machine and other materials for her work. She hopes to increase, expand, and generate even more income from her business and provide a more secure and stable life for her family. She wants to thank all of the Kiva lenders for their second support!

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and other materials for her work.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 48-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 5 children. The oldest child is 24 while the youngest is 9. She engages in a hog raising business. She raises pigs. 

She has been raising hogs for more than 10 years now. On the other hand, her husband works as a carpenter. His income is not enough for the family's daily expenses, so Angelita requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy feed, so the pigs can grow healthy and will be able to be sold on time. In the future, Angelita would like to improve her hog raising business to become more sustainable to provide her family with good living conditions as well as to save for the college education of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Good Work Group

texts.en:
Mwarabu, who is in his late 20s, is married and has a son and a daughter. One of the Mwarabu's children is in school. He has been running a business selling local chickens since 2007. Usually he obtains these chickens from villages where they are available and at a low price. It takes about four days for  him to obtain those chickens and to resell. He works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily in the market and is able to sell 80 to 120 chickens, making a good profit per month. 

This will be his first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania which he will use to buy more local chickens from different villages. He dreams of building a nice house. He will share this loan with his loan group, "GOOD WORK," which consist of 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more local chickens from different villages.

loans.name: Vivina

texts.en:
Vivina is a 55-year-old married woman and resident of the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her town. She has been in the business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. 
Vivina is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her inventory and attract more buyers to her store thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab, age 21, is single and lives in the Telavi district with his parents and retired grandparents. His mother is an accountant at the technical store and his father serves locals as a taxi driver.

Zurab had to start working at a very young age and runs a car import business with his friend. They order second-hand cars from Europe, USA, and Japan and sell them in their district. These young fellows get special orders from clients and their profit is small. 

Zurab is very hard-working man, with a great desire to get ahead. He decided to diversify the business and obtain credit for starting a car wash. Zurab requested a loan to MFO Credo and the application was approved in the framework of a startup program that enables inexperienced borrowers to begin new businesses.

With the received loan, Zurab will purchase essential equipment: vacuum cleaner, hoses, power washers, etc. He will provide services to local community members and hopes to increase his monthly income. The new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family and give Zurab the opportunity to make savings for house renovation. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to start a car wash and purchase essential equipment.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a 47-year-old married woman from Kutaisi district. She lives with her 48-year-old husband Gia and their two sons, who go to school. Nana is unemployed at the moment. Gia has a workshop where he produces different kinds of footwear by orders. As this is the only income for their family and it isn’t stable, Nana decided to start her own business with a loan.

Her loan request was rejected several times by financial institutions, as she wasn’t able to satisfy their requirements because of lack of business experience and financial stability. She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, a so called Start-Up program, which gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.

With the loan of $2700, Nana will open a grocery store. She will purchase a stock of groceries and household goods. As the grocery shop is opened, Nana will become financially independent. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. With the increased income she will pay for her sons' educations and will expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоире 42 года. Она трудолюбивая и замечательная женщина. Шоира как порядочная женщина имеет счастливую семью. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Муж Шоиры работает в фермерском хозяйстве. Она выращивает овощи и реализует на местном рынке. Шоира 5 лет назад начала свой бизнес скотоводством, так как доход ее мужа не хватает для обеспечения семьи. Шоира постепенно развевает бизнес, и ее скот становится конкурентоспособным на местном рынке. Шоира получает от данного бизнеса хороший доход, так как ее муж выращивает сено для скота и ей дешево обходится откорм скота. Она хочет развевать бизнес дальше и увеличить доход. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить детей хорошим условием проживания и дать шанс для обучения. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shoira is 42 years old.  She is a hardworking and remarkable woman. As she is a decent woman, she has a happy family. She is married and raising two children. Shoira's husband works on a farm. She grows vegetables and sells them at a local market. Five years ago, Shoira started her livestock business, as her husband's income was not enough to meet the family's needs. Shoira has steadily grown her business, and her livestock is becoming competitive on the local market. Shoira receives a good income from her business, as her husband grows hay for the cattle and it is cheap for her to feed them. She wants to grow her business further and increase her income. She plans to use the income to provide her children with good living conditions and give them a chance for an education. She has requested a loan in the amount of 5000 somons for the purchase of cattle.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Berta Lilian

texts.es: Berta de 39 años de edad es muy amable y trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, Ella trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maiz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en el granero que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarla a los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia. Berta solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, ella ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Berta, 39 years old, is very friendly and hardworking. She lives with her husband and her two children. 

She works very hard on her own farm where she grows corn and beans. Her products are of very high quality. When her harvest is ready it’s deposited in the storage place in the barn shown in the photograph and then later it is sold to different markets that are near her home.

Berta is asking for a loan from Integral in order to have the necessary money and to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as pest controls, fertilizer, compost, seed, and more things that she needs for planting.

She is very eager for her sales to increase and to be able to make higher profits and give her family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as pest controls, fertilizer, compost, seed, and more things

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 41-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of seven children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver, by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has been not working properly. Because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it, as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Razia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will enable him to resume his business. Razia is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to the rickshaw that her husband drives

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cell phones, accessories, headsets, batteries, chargers, etc.

loans.name: Prayer Warriors Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39 year old Winnet from Mutare. She is widowed, with four children, three of whom attend school.

Winnet runs an agriculture business rearing broilers. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenge is that of high mortality rate during winter periods. Winnet has requested a loan of $600 to buy more feed for the chicks. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan, will allow her to send her children to better schools. In the future, Winnet plans to supply chicken to shops and hotels around town.

loans.use: to buy more feed for the poultry project

loans.name: Mt Ulunguru Group

texts.en:
Frank, who is in his early 30s, is single. He has been running a shop selling DVDs - movies and audios.  He is also a music player (DJ) at private parties and ceremonies.  Frank has been engaged in these activities for five years. He works from 8am to 7pm daily, but sometimes up to midnight hours, in case he has a music play job.  He is able to make a good profit per month. 

This will be his second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loan, Frank restocked more DVDs-movies which resold to more customers. He has paid back his loan successfully.  He used the return from the business to cover household expenses, and saved part of it, to reinvest in the business. He will use this loan to buy a business computer and restock more DVDs for resale. He dreams of being able to expand his business some day. 

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Mt Ulunguru" which has12 members.  They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a business computer and restock more DVDs to resell.

loans.name: Kotognogontala  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles  au quartier  FANGATONON  de LOUTANA, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leurs troisièmes prêts avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz avec  MARIAM debout en première position sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO  après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 70.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the group called KOTOGNOGONTALA II are married women with an average age of 45 and on average six children, all living in traditional families in the Fangatonon area of Loutana, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution and the other two loans have been correctly reimbursed. 

Mariam, first person standing in the photo, cultivates rice. She intends to use her loan to buy farm inputs, seeds and pay the fees for plowing to maintain one half hectare. Her produce is sold right in the village and in Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women.
 
She expects to make a profit of 70,000 F CFA each season. This profit will permit her to repay her loan and also help the extended family with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds and pay fees for plowing, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system in order to light her home

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita is 22 years old and married. She has one child. She wants to start a small business in her community, making and selling pancakes. To do this, she needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, dripping oil, baking powder, and plastic bags. In the future, Makerita hopes to improve her family's living standard. She joined SPBD in 2013, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To buy sacks of flour, dripping oil, baking powder, and plastic bags, for her pancake business

loans.name: Irfana

texts.en:
Irfana, age 30, is a housewife who adores her family.  Her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

He owns a chicken shop which is the only source of income for the family.  Irfana is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of improving her husband's business.  He will use the loan amount to purchase chicken for his shop. With the profits expected from this loan, he wants to save for his children's education. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase chicken to sell.

loans.name: Dile

texts.en:
A loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek will enable Dile to repair the stable of her animals. Dile and her family live in northern Albania, and all what they have been doing for a living these past thirteen years, has been agriculture/livestock - selling milk and other dairy products, and baby calves to the locals.

“It requires hard work, but the outcome is positive; we make an income and this is the most important. Now that my four kids are grownups they help too, so it becomes easier on me. Earlier, I had to do all the work, feeding and pasturing the animals, cleaning up their space, planting, harvesting and securing fodder for them during the summer months, milking, making cheese and butter. Now, I don’t have to do it all by myself, I have help. Thank God. ” said Dile.

loans.use: to repair her animal's stable

loans.name: Sovanphoum

texts.en:
Sovanphoum (in the photo), age 26, has been married since 2011. He lives with his wife and their young son in a village about thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. His wife sells grocery items at home. 

Sovanphoum is in year four and it’s the last year of his Bachelor's degree, with a major in electrical engineering. He is asking for his first Kiva loan in order to pay his school fees.

In addition, Sovanphoum is also an electrician for a private company.

loans.use: To pay his school fees.

loans.name: Tamba Group

texts.en:
Anuru, who is in her late 30s, is married and has three girls, who are in school. For 18 years now, Anuru has been running a food selling business (mamalishe). She works from 6:00am to 4:00pm daily and is able to make a good profit per month.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Her previous loans were all paid back successfully. With those loan, she bought three cooking pots, 50kgs of rice, and other food cooking items. She used her profits to cover school fees, household expenses, and to reinvest in the business. She will use this new loan to buy business equipment to replace the old ones, like chairs and tables. She dreams that one day, she will be able to expand her business by cooking more varieties of food, and by opening branches in other areas.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Tamba," which totals 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy business equipment to replace the old ones, like chairs and tables

loans.name: Dalmacia

texts.en:
Dalmacia is a 68-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She is engaged in making furniture made of bamboo, such as cribs, chairs and tables. She has been making bamboo furniture for more than ten years. 

She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy bamboo, nails and varnish. 

In the future, Dalmacia hopes to succeed and to have a sustainable livelihood in order to save some of the profits in preparation for old age.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, nails and varnish.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es: Don sabino de 60 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 35 años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y el maicillo, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que su familia tiene, vive  en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comparar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando el los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
Mr. Sabino, 60, has been working in agriculture for 35 years and it has given him the ability and necessary knowledge to tend his crops. His main crops are corn and sorghum. He sells his crops to wholesalers of staple grains that are near his place of residence. With the profits from his sales, he manages to cover the living expenses that his family has. 

He lives in his own house with his wife and four children. He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies that will help him with planting his crops like manure, seeds, fertilizer, etc. so he can have better profits and continue helping with the expenses of his house without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Paz De Maria

texts.es: Paz de 47 años de edad, se dedica al cultivo de maiz y maicillo desde hace 4 años,  de esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de como ganarse la vida. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, honrada y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo. Paz Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Paz, 47, has cultivated corn and sorghum for four years, which is how she makes her living. Cultivation is done every year, and it is the only way she knows how to make a living. She is very hardworking, honest and responsible. Despite her humble living conditions, she never tires of working and giving the best to her family. She lives in her own house with her husband and son. Paz has made the decision to apply for a loan to buy basic agricultural supplies: manure, pest poisons, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, etc. She hopes to have favorable results as she has no other source of income. She trusts that she will have an abundant harvest that will allow her to continue bringing home the daily bread.

loans.use: to buy manure, pest poisons, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Rollan

texts.en:
This is Rollan.  He previously availed himself of a 10,000 PHP loan, that he used to buy books. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy more books. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a higher profit. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in his heart.

Rollan hopes that his business will continue to grow and expand. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business, and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more books to sell at his store

loans.name: Kokosan Group

texts.en:
“ Kokosan group” was formed in March 2008. It has been running for 5 years 3 months. This group is located in a small town in Indonesia, specifically in the town of Cilacap. This group consists of 11 people, who have a variety of businesses. Businesses like: selling snacks, such as: dent, risoles, martabak sweet, fried soybean, tofu and steamed cakes for snacks; starting eateries; opening a grocery shop; selling clothes on credit. They support each other and complement each other. They  visit the sick, while bringing financial support for  treatment. This loan plan  will be  used to open their own shops, buy better means of production, add new types of food.

The group is led by a woman named Endang; she has five children who have completed their schooling. In fact they are already married and have children. Endang is the business leader and has a roadside food stall in the large city center. With this loan, Endang expects to rent some additional  places for her food cart and add more types of vegetables or dishes that are  preferred by the community. With  these loans,  Endang expects the businesses and the income of each of the “group Kokosan” members to improve as well.

loans.use: to rent additional  places for her food cart and add more types of vegetables

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Amalia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF, to buy additional fishing materials for her business.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Milona

texts.en:
Milona started her business selling a few products. After several years of hard work and patience, her business bloomed and is continuously growing. She uses her loan as an additional capital for her business and in return it helps her in sending her child to school.
 
She would now like to apply for a 27,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Milona dreams of having more sources of income and hopes to have their own house and lot. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Pazilat

texts.ru: Пазилат замужняя женщина в возрасте 55 лет является жительницей города Душанбе. У нее двое взрослых детей - дочери 24 года, сыну 22 года. Ее сын в данный момент работает мигрантом в России. Сама Пазилат занимается торговлей. Два года тому назад Пазилат около дома открыла продуктовый магазин. Она продает там такие продукты как сахар, чай, печенье, вафли, рулет, масло, шоколад, конфеты, напитки, колбасные изделия, сметана и т.д., а также хозяйственные товары. Ее товар всегда в спросе и приносит ей хорошую прибыль, за счет которого она обеспечивает семью и продвигает бизнес. Пазилат женщина жизнерадостная и пунктуальная. Она обращается со своими клиентами вежливо и доброжелательно. Пазилат сейчас запрашивает кредит для увеличения товарооборота. На сумму кредита она хочет увеличить ассортимент продуктов питания.
texts.en: Pazilat is a married 55-year-old woman who lives in Dushanbe. She has two grown children - a 24-year-old daughter, and a 22-year-old son. Her son is currently working as a migrant in Russia. Pazilat works as a vendor. Two years ago, Pazilat opened a grocery store near her home. There, she sells goods such as sugar, tea, cookies, wafers, rolls, butter, chocolate, candies, drinks, sausages, sour cream, and so forth, as well as household items. Her merchandise is always in demand, and brings her a good profit, which she uses to provide for her family and expand her business. Pazilat is a joyful and punctual woman. She treats her customers with kindness and politeness. Pazilat has requested a loan to increase her merchandise stock. She plans to use the loan to increase the assortment of food products she sells.

loans.use: to purchase food products to sell in order to expand her business

loans.name: Ismenia Delfina

texts.es:
Ismenia, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para continuar trabajando en su negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar una mesa para la venta de atole.
El crédito anterior fue favorable, ya que logro fortalecer su negocio y seguir trabajando  para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en: Ismenia is presented with the need of choosing a new loan to continue working in her business. This investment will help her to buy a table for the sale of atole [corn-based drink]. The previous loan was advantageous because she was able to strengthen her business and keep working to satisfy her customers' needs. The family circumstances are the same.

loans.use: to buy a table to sell atole.

loans.name: Rauli

texts.en:
Rauli is a 29-year-old young single man. He lives with his mother in a small village of Marneuli district. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. 

Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Rauli was unable to study for a professional career. He works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing maize, and he does all the agricultural work to make sure of a good harvest. Besides, he has 2 milking cows and 5 pigs. Rauli’s mother milks the cows and produces dairy products (yogurt, cheese) for selling. 

As the family has only seasonal income, Rauli decided to start his own business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. 

His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $2,000 for purchasing a car. After purchasing a car, Rauli will begin trade with fruits and vegetables. He will purchase fruits and vegetables from the wholesalers in different villages, and then resell them in the capital city at a higher price. 

The start-up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a car so he can begin trade with fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: Don José de 62 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de frijol y tomates. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante 40 años de su vida y es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás, vive en casa propia con su hija y sus dos nietos. Debido a que ya es temporada de siembra tomo la decisión de comenzar a prepararse. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que él consigue el sustento para su familia.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Don José is 62 years old and works in agriculture, growing beans and tomatoes. He has been a farmer for 40 years and that is how he earns his daily living. He is a hardworking, responsible man who is well-known in the area for his huge heart and kindness to others. He lives in his own house with his daughter and two grandchildren. Due to the fact that it is planting season, he decided to make preparations, and that is why he is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL. He will use this money to invest in the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, etc. What he would like more than anything is for his harvest to be abundant and better than previous ones, given that this is how he supports his family. He trusts in God that with his help, and his own dedication and hard work, that he will achieve his dream of improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Kausar is a 33-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband manufactures chains to sell. This shop is the only source of income for the family. His monthly income is insufficient to meet the daily expenses. Presently, he needs to purchase iron coil for manufacturing chains to sell. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of purchasing the needful things for his business. 

Therefore, Kausar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband. This will help him to continue his business. With the profit expected from this loan, he wants to purchase daily household food items. 

Kausar is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase iron coil for manufacturing chains to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria has owned and operated a variety store for many years. Aside from her variety store, she also has a farm. She used her previous loan as additional capital, and her income supported her family's everyday expenses. At her age, she still works to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time in the amount of 50,000 PHP. She will use it to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products, to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to continue meeting her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness, and thankfulness in her heart.

Gloria dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages, to resell at her store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman, aged 42. She has three children who attend school. Her husband is a businessman, and together they own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a tailoring business for the past five years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 56 years old. She is married with three children aged between 14 and 23, and they all go to schools. She would like to buy more sorghum for resale.

The profits from the business will be used to buy more rice for resale.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Sulaymon

texts.ru:
Сулаймон заботливый отец 4 детей. Ему 63 года. Он женат и прожил счастливую жизнь со своей женой. Сулаймон имеет большой жизненный опыт. Он проработал во многих местах и последние 3 года он занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Он имеет свою машину марки «Нисан-Серена». Он перевозит пассажиров из своего района в город и обратно перевозит пассажиров с города в район. Сулаймон в течение 1 дня делает 2 рейса. Он старается предоставить услугу на высшем уровне, так как конкуренция очень большая. С полученного дохода он улучшает условию проживания для своей семьи. Он хочет отремонтировать свою машину, так как его машина нуждается в капитальном ремонте. 
Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для ремонта машины. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sulaymon is a caring father of 4 children. He is 63 years old. He is married and has lived a happy life with his wife. Sulaymon has a lot of life experience. He has worked in a lot of places and, for the last 3 years, has been working as a taxi driver. He has his own car, a Nissan Serena. He drives passengers from their region into town, and then drives them back from town to their region. Sulaymon makes two trips per day. He tries to provide service of the highest caliber, as the competition is quite high. He uses his earnings to improve the quality of life for his family. He wants to repair his car, as his car is in need of capital repairs.  He has requested a loan in the amount of 2000 somons for the repair of his vehicle.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to repair the car which is the source of his income

loans.name: Ruth Noemi

texts.es: Ruth de 49 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo y sus  dos hijos, ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar  ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, elástico, botones, agujas, etc. para la elaboración de variedad de prendas de vestir. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ruth, 49, lives in a house she owns together with her husband and their two children. She has a business making clothingwhich she runs out of her home. She is an exemplary woman - hardworking, responsible and positive. Many people give good references her character and her work. 

She makes a variety of clothing items at affordable prices. She also offers quality work, which is why many people like her. She has spent many years doing this work, so she has plenty of experience and regular customers who prefer her more every day. She has made the decision to apply for this loan with INTEGRAL to invest in her small business and buy necessary supplies such as fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, needles, etc. to make a variety of garments. All this is done in order to provide better service to customers so that customers are motivated to continue to seek her services and so her sales and income increase. She hopes to achieve her goal and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru: Гулноза молодая и энергичная женщина. Ей 22 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Гулноза шьёт красивые национальные платья. Она имеет свою швейную машинку. Гулноза шьёт платья дома и в течение 1 дня шьёт 3 платья. Она шьёт также аккуратно и профессионально европейские платья, как национальные. Она продаёт свою продукцию на местном рынке и имеет своих клиентов. Она хочет развевать свой бизнес. Гулноза запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки вышивальной машины. Таким путем она будет улучшить качество продукции. Она имеет большую мечту открыть свой цех по шитью национальной женской одежды. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Gulnoza is a young and energetic woman. She is 22 years old.  She is unmarried and lives with her parents. Gulnoza sews beautiful ethnic dresses. She has her own sewing machine. Gulnoza sews dresses at home and sews 3 dresses per day. She sews European dresses as neatly and professionally as the ethnic dresses.  She sells her goods at a local market and has her own clients. She hopes to expand her business. Gulnoza has requested a loan in the amount of 4000 somons for the purchase of an embroidery machine. This way, she can improve the quality of her work. She has big dreams of opening her own shop for sewing women's ethnic clothing. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy embroidery machine to increase working capital

loans.name: Dima

texts.en:
Dima is a 35-year-old married mother of two children, who has been selling clothes for thirteen years. Dima helps her beloved husband in making their living and covering their family's increasing expenses. Her husband works as a driver, his low income isn't enough to cover their family's needs. That's why Dima works hard to develop her business, to satisfy both her customers and family members.

Today, Dima is applying for her first loan from KIv'a partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection, Most of the local villagers prepare themselves to celebrate the end of Holy Ramadan month. They buy new clothes for this occasion, so she has to be prepared. She hopes to keep on developing her business, and continue to satisfy her customers needs.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru:
Толиб 50-летний мужчина, занимается торговлей DVD проигрывателей, тюнеров, телевизоров. Он очень честный и пунктуальный человек.  Вот уже более десяти лет занимается этим видом деятельности.  За этот период он намного  расширил свой товарооборот, и это благодаря его усилиям и упорностью. 
Толиб кредитуется в Арванде уже несколько лет. Во время кредитования он показал себя с лучшей стороны. Его жена работает государственном учреждении и тоже вкладывает свой капитал в семейный бюджет. У него двое взрослых сыновей они тоже работают. 
Толиб покупает товар у поставщиков, и ему это очень удобно. Недавно Толиб отремонтировал свой дом, который был в очень плохом состоянии, и все что он накопил все ушло на ремонт. Теперь Толиб хочет приобрести новый товар у поставщиков но ему не хватает денежных средств, поэтому он с ново обратился в Арванд. Он очень надеется что, в Арванде в очередной раз его поддержат и он сможет дальше развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en: Tolib is a 50-year-old man who sells DVD players, tuners and televisions. He is a very honest and punctual person.  He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  During this period, he has greatly expanded his business thanks to his efforts and persistence. Tolib has been borrowing with Avrand for several years. During the time he was taking out loans, he has shown himself in the best light. His wife works at a government office, and also adds her income to the family budget. He has two adult sons, who also work. Tolib purchases merchandise from suppliers, and it is very convenient for him.  Recently, Tolib has repaired his home, which was in a very poor condition,  and all of his savings have gone towards the repairs.  Now, Tolib wants to obtain new merchandise from his suppliers, but he does not have enough money, so he has once again turned to Avrand.  He is very hopeful that Avrand can once again support him and that he can further expand his business.

loans.use: to buy household appliances

loans.name: Sevao

texts.en: Sevao is 36 years old and married with 4 children. She owns and operates a business venture, elei business.  She has 2 years of experience in this line of business. Sevao needs a loan to buy materials, colored fabric paints, paint brushes, designing rubber, sewing machine and designing tools.  She hopes to use her profits to support her family and to help her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy materials, colored fabric paints, paint brushes, designing rubber, sewing machine and designing tools

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Муборак благодаря своим родителям получила высшее образование. Она окончила Педагогический Институт. Муборак всю свою жизнь посветила образованию подрастающему  поколению. Она более 29 лет работает в школе. Муборак замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее дети прекрасные люди, так как Муборак выделяет большое внимание для их воспитания и образования. Муборак живет вместе со своей семьёй в маленьком домике, который нуждается в капитальном ремонте. Муборак должна отремонтировать все комнаты до наступления зимы. Она получает маленькую зарплату и поэтому не имеет денег для покупки строительных материалов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки цемента, краски и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muborak obtained a higher education, thanks to her parents.  She graduated from the Pedagogical Institute.  Muborak devoted all of her life to educating the growing generation.  She has been working at a school for 29 years.  Muborak is married and raising four children.  Her children are beautiful people because Muborak gives a lot of attention to their upbringing and education.  Muborak lives together with her family in a small house that needs major repairs.  Muborak has to repair all of the rooms before the onset of winter.  She receives a small salary and, thus, does not have money to buy construction materials.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy cement, paint, etc.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement and paint, and repair her house

loans.name: Zulaikho

texts.ru: Зулайхо 50-летняя замужняя женщина. У нее четверо детей. Зулайхо и ее семья проживают в городе Душанбе. В течение 12 лет Зулайхо работает учительницей в средней школе. Она преподает по русскому языку. Ее старший сын находится на заработках в загранице и по мере возможности высылает матери деньги. Второй сын студент. Он закончил второй курс учебы в Технологическом Университете. Сейчас Зулайхо необходимо заплатить за третий курс обучения. Она нуждается в кредите в размере 1100 долларов США. Зулайхо жалеет, что не смогла дать высшее образование своему старшему сыну, который работает мигрантом. Поэтому она очень хочет чтобы ее второй сын успешно завершил учебу, чтобы в будущем он стал бы хорошим специалистом и нашел бы себе достойную работу.
texts.en: Zulaikho is a 50 year-old, married woman.  She has four children.  Zulaikho and her family live in the city of Dushanbe.  She has been working as a teacher at a secondary school for 12 years.  She teaches Russian language.  Her oldest son works abroad and sends money to his mother when he can.  Her second son is a student.  He completed his second year of studies at the Technological University.  Now Zulaikho needs to pay for his third year of studies.  She needs a loan in the amount of 1100 US dollars.  Zulaikho regrets that she could not provide a higher education to her oldest son, who is a migrant worker.  This is why she really wants her second son to successfully finish his studies, so that he could become a good specialist in the future and find himself a decent job.

loans.use: to pay for her son's third year university tuition

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru: Гулрухсору 29 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Гулрухсор более 5 лет работает дворником. Она честно и качественно выполняет свою работу. Гулрухсор сама чистоплотная женщина и поэтому старается, чтобы ее город был чистым и развивающим. Она хочет, чтобы ее город процветал и стал лучшим городом в Таджикистане. Гулрухсор и ее родители живут в старом доме. Она уже несколько лет мечтает отремонтировать их дом, но ее зарплата не хватает. Ее родители тоже малоимущие люди. Гулрухсор запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulruhsor is 29 years old.  She is not married and lives with her parents.  She is a hardworking and driven woman.  Gulruhsor has been working as a janitor for over 5 years.  She completes her work honestly and with quality.  Gulruhsor is loves cleanliness herself and, thus, tries to make her city clean and developing.  She wants to see her city flourish and become the best city in Tajikistan.  Gulruhsor and her parents live in an old house.  She has been dreaming of repairing their house for several years, but her salary is not enough for this.  Her parents are also low-income people.  Gulruhsor is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni to purchase construction materials, such as cement, wood, etc.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement and wood, and repair her house

loans.name: Fofoga

texts.en: Fofoga is 51 years old and married with 6 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, frying pan, kerosene oven, baking spoon and dripping oil.  In the future, Fofoga hopes to upgrade her family's standard of living.  She joined SPBD in 2013, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, frying pan, kerosene oven, baking spoon and dripping oil

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура с детства мечтала быть медиком. Она после окончания средней школы поступила в Медицинский колледж. Успешно окончив колледж, она поступила на работу в амбулатории своего села. Она уже работает более 27 лет. Она является одной из успешных работников амбулатории. После работы она помогает своему мужу по земледелию. Манзура и ее муж воспитывают 2 детей. Ее семья уже давно мечтает о красивом доме, но они не имеют денег для того, чтобы сделать капитальный ремонт и улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, песок и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Manzura had been dreaming of becoming a medic since childhood.  She got accepted to the Medical college after completing a secondary school.  After successfully completing the college, she got a job at a clinic in her village.  She has been working for over 27 years.  She is one of the most successful clinic workers.  She also helps her husband with farming after work.  Manzura and her husband are raising two children.  Her family has been dreaming of a beautiful house, but does not have money to make major repairs and improve their living conditions.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to buy construction materials, such as cement, wood, sand, etc.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, wood, sand, etc., and repair her house

loans.name: Norsita

texts.en:
Norsita is 27 years old and married with two children.

Norsita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like shampoo,rice, eggs,  sugar, groceries, etc. to sell.

Norsita has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from poultry.

Norsita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like shampoo, rice, eggs, sugar, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a banana retail business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell.

Rona has been in this business for 12 years. Rona earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She has fully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this loan to further build her motorcycle transport and banana business.

Rona has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Shahzadi

texts.en: Shahzadi is a 50 year old woman.  She lives in Lahore, Pakistan.  She is a responsible mother of 6-children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly because of which he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. Therefore Shahzadi has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Shahzadi is very thankful to kiva.

loans.use: To cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hard working mother, in the coconut business for over twenty years. Her loan, which she used as additional capital, went a long way in her business.  Her income assisted her in her children's studies and in their everyday expenses.  Nenita and her husband are both working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 26,000 PHP loan to purchase more coconuts.  The profits from her business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gratitude.

Nenita hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams of having a good future.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for coconuts

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally works hard to support her family. Sally is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

Sally requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to process as dried fish.

Sally has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Sally  would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to process

loans.name: Rosmiry

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosmiry works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Rosmiry is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport  business.

Rosmiry has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle business

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 50 years old, married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Sally has a general store in the Philippines. Sally requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF, to buy additional items like eggs, noodles, soap, toothpaste, groceries, etc. to sell.

Sally has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Sally would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, noodles, soap, toothpaste, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Srey Mom's Group

texts.en:
Srey Mom was selected to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. There are two members in the group and they live in a village in Phnom Penh suburbs.

1-Srey Mom, age 22, is single. She lives with her parents and brother and sister. Srey Mom has just finished her first year of Accountant Institute in Phnom Penh. She will continue to her second year and first semester, hence she decided to apply for a loan to pay her school fee. 2-Sreymoch, age 20, is single. She lives with her parents and sister and brother. Sreymoch has just finished her first year of her Accountant Institute in Phnom Penh. She will continue to her second year and first semester, hence she decided to apply for a loan to pay her school fee.

Normally, in Cambodia we need to study four years for a bachelors degree. The year is divided into two semesters. Photo: Srey Mom is on the left and Sreymoch is on the right.

loans.use: To pay for school fees.

loans.name: Telma Aracely

texts.es: Doña Telma vive con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la  venta de frutas y verduras:  chiles, papas,  tomates, cebollas, entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; doña telma es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor, doña telma tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecida con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Telma lives with her ​​life partner, she sells fruit and vegetables: peppers, potatoes, tomatoes, onions, among other items. She has had the business for several years and this has given her extensive experience in sales allowing her to make the most profit. The location where she sells is very strategic and visited by many people. She has many customers that prefer her because her products are fresh, of good value, high quality and with excellent service. 

Telma is an enterprising woman, dedicated to her work and eager to get ahead. She is always looking for alternatives that allow her to succeed. In recent weeks demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of this opportunity to make a new investment, but doesn't have enough capital so she is requesting a new loan from INTEGRAL. This loan will allow her to purchase fruits and vegetables wholesale.

Telma  has payment has good credit references and ensures that she can pay off the debt. She is grateful for the support and knows that this will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy peppers, potatoes, tomatoes, onions, etc.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago es un joven de 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive únicamente con su mamá; ha pasado por situaciones difíciles debido a la inestabilidad económica en su hogar. Actualmente se dedica a estudiar, pero por falta de experiencia laboral y de conocimientos le ha sido difícil encontrar oportunidades de empleo, pero su visión y sus ganas de salir adelante lo motivaron para solicitar el crédito, que invertirá en el pago de un curso de capacitación en Servicio de Mesa y Bar, con lo cual podrá adquirir conocimientos y abrirse puertas en el campo laboral. 
Santiago sueña con salir adelante montando su propio negocio, que sea próspero y rentable, para así poder obtener ingresos, que le permitan brindar apoyo económico y una mejor calidad de vida a su mamá.
texts.en:
Santiago is a 20 year old, he is single and lives alone with his mother. He has been through difficult situations due to economic instability at home. 

Currently he is a student, but due to lack of workplace knowledge and experience, it has been difficult to find employment opportunities.
However, his vision and his desire to succeed motivated him to request this loan which he will invest to pay for a training course in "Bar & Table Service", with which he can acquire knowledge and open doors in the workplace.

Santiago dreams of getting ahead by starting his own business. He hopes that it will thrive and be profitable in order to earn revenue that will enable him to provide financial support and a better quality of life for his mom.

loans.use: to pay for a training course on "Bar & Table Service"

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more variety of wholesale shoes and sandals

loans.name: Sinignesigui Group

texts.fr:
Les  9 membres du groupe  SINIGNESIGUI sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles  au quartier  KOULOUKOUNA de LOUTANA, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leurs troisièmes prêts avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
